title: Getting Started
scenario: You just logged into a Linux system. First, let's find out where you are. Use the appropriate command to print your current working directory.
hints: The command you need stands for "Print Working Directory"
It's a 3-letter command that starts with "p"

title: Exploring Directories
scenario: Now that you know where you are, let's see what files and directories are in your current location. List the contents of the current directory.

title: Detailed Listing
scenario: Great! Now let's get more details about the files. Use the long listing format to see file permissions, sizes, and modification dates.
hints: You need to add an option flag to the ls command
The flag for long format is "-l"
